newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia to open coffee registrations Monday.
newsitem.headline: Colombia to open coffee registrations Monday.

text.p: Colombia's National Coffee Growers' Federation said it would open July-August coffee registrations for shipments by private exporters on Monday.

The federation previously announced, in a statement late Thursday, that no limits would be placed on shipments during the two-month period -- meaning that private exporters would be free to ship as much coffee as they can get their hands on given the extremely tight domestic supply situation.

A brief statement announcing the opening of regsitrations noted that a $0.30 premimum would be demanded for every pound of coffee sold on international markets. The preimum was previously set at $0.13 per pound but it was raised to $0.30 in mid-May, when the federation reopened May-June coffee registrations.
The federation gave no indication, in its statement Friday, as to when June registrations will close.
